item.name: SQL Server: % Buffer cache hit ratio
item.description: Indicates the percentage of pages found in the buffer cache without having to read from disk. The ratio is the total number of cache hits divided by the total number of cache lookups over the last few thousand page accesses.

item.name: SQL Server: % Processor Time
item.description: % Processor Time is the percentage of elapsed time that all of the threads of this process used the processor to execute instructions.

item.name: SQL Server: Batch Requests per second
item.description: Number of command batches received per second. It is usually a good indicator of the load on SQL Server.

item.name: SQL Server: Database Pages
item.description: How many database pages are currently being occupied in the data cache.

item.name: SQL Server: Data File Size (Total)
item.description: Total size (in kilobytes) of all the data files.

item.name: SQL Server: Errors per second
item.description: Tracks severe errors that cause SQL Server to take the current database offline.

item.name: SQL Server: Lock Average Wait Time
item.description: The average amount of wait time (milliseconds) for each lock request that resulted in a wait.

item.name: SQL Server: Lock Waits per second
item.description: Number of lock requests that could not be satisfied immediately and required the caller to wait before being granted the lock.

item.name: SQL Server: Log File Size (Total)
item.description: Total size (in kilobytes) of all the transaction log files.

item.name: SQL Server: Log File Used Size (Total)
item.description: The cumulative used size of all the log files in the database.

item.name: SQL Server: Number Failed Jobs
item.description: The number of jobs with a last run status of “Failed”.

item.name: SQL Server: Number of Deadlocks per second
item.description: Number of lock requests that resulted in a deadlock.

item.name: SQL Server: Number Users Connected
item.description: Number of users connected to SQL Server.

item.name: SQL Server: Port Availability
item.description: Test the availability of SQL Server on TCP port 1433.

item.name: SQL Server: Total Server Memory
item.description: The committed memory from the buffer pool (in kilobytes). Note: this is not the total memory used by SQL Server.

item.name: SQL Server: Transactions Number (Total)
item.description: The number of currently active transactions of all types.

item.name: SQL Server: Transactions per second (Total)
item.description: Total number of transactions started for all databases per second.

item.name: SQL Server: Version
item.description: Returns version, processor architecture, build date, and operating system for the current installation of SQL Server.

discovery_rule.name: Database discovery
discovery_rule.params: select '{"data":[', (SELECT STUFF((SELECT ',' + '{"{#DBNAME}":"' + [Name] + '"}' FROM master..sysdatabases ORDER BY [Name] FOR XML PATH('')), 1, 1, '')) ,']}' FOR XML PATH('')
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of Databases as defined in global regular expression "Databases for discovery".

item_prototype.name: SQL Server: Instance {#DBNAME}: Data File Size
item_prototype.description: Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the data files in the database including any automatic growth.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server: Instance {#DBNAME}: Log File Size
item_prototype.description: Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the transaction log files in the database.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server: Instance {#DBNAME}: State
item_prototype.params: select coalesce(max(state),7) from sys.databases where name = '{#DBNAME}'
item_prototype.description: State of a specific database. The values: 0 = ONLINE, 1 = RESTORING, 2 = RECOVERING, 3 = RECOVERY_PENDING, 4 = SUSPECT, 5 = EMERGENCY, 6 = OFFLINE, 7 = Database Does Not Exist on Server.

item_prototype.name: SQL Server: Instance {#DBNAME}: Transactions per second
item_prototype.description: Number of transactions started for the database per second.

trigger_prototype.name: The database '{#DBNAME}' state is no longer online.

trigger.name: SQL: Failed jobs exists on the {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template App Microsoft SQL Server:perf_counter[\SQLServer:Buffer Manager\Buffer cache hit ratio].last()}<70
trigger.name: SQL: SQL Server is not obtaining enough memory from the operating system
SQL Server general information was changed on {HOST.NAME}
SQL Server port is Down on {HOST.NAME}
